titleStmt.title: And as the shores of the sea
a machine readable transcription
titleStmt.author: Walt Whitman
titleStmt.sponsor: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities, University of Nebraska-Lincoln
titleStmt.funder: The National Endowment for the Humanities

address.addrLine: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

availability.p: The text of the original item is in the public domain. The text encoding and editorial notes were created and/or prepared by the Walt Whitman Archive and are licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License (CC BY 4.0). Any reuse of the material should credit the Walt Whitman Archive.

notesStmt.note: This manuscript was likely written between 1850 and 1855 when Whitman was composing his first edition of Leaves of Grass.

bibl.author: Walt Whitman
bibl.title: And as the shores of the sea
bibl.orgName: Papers of Walt Whitman (MSS 3829), Clifton Waller Barrett Library of American Literature, Albert H. Small Special Collections Library, University of Virginia
bibl.note: Transcribed from digital images of the original.

body.p:
And as my coast isarethe bay andsea,shores of the sea I live near and loveto me, so
are the sea coasts of Syria,
shores of France, Spain,
Pr all the lan seas of the
earth to those who live near
and love them,
And as the mountains of my land
are to me, so are the Alps,
Pyranees, the Styrian hills, Carnaks,
Balks, Sedlets mountains, to the
people of those lands.
